file_content.text: Thanks to you, the Empire's military superiority is secure.
Heard there were quite a few explosions in the industrial sector. Made me wish I was back in the field again.
Heard you were very thorough and hunted down those team leaders, as well. The Empire owes you.
I take it no more prototypes remain? I regret I couldn't see you in action. The Empire owes you.
It was a pleasure.
It was nothing.
How about we talk about you giving me credits.
Payment. Now.
I'm authorized to give you this reward for your inestimable service.
Thanks to you, the Empire's military superiority is secure once more.
Please, destroy those prototypes, the labs, and if possible, the team leaders who worked on them.
My lord, a moment of your time. We have a big mess on our hands, and I need help preventing it from becoming an enormous one.
Agent. Am I glad you showed up. We have a big mess on our hands, and we need to stop it from becoming an enormous one.
I need your attention. We have a big mess on our hands, and I need help to prevent it from becoming a huge one.
Normally, I wouldn't bother someone of your stature, but the Empire's military superiority is at stake.
I need someone who can safeguard that superiority.
Preserving the Empire's military superiority wasn't exactly on my to-do list, but it could be fun.
I suppose that's me.
I'm sorry to impose on your schedule, my lord.
And what price does the Empire put on its military superiority?
I don't work for free.
The Empire pays. Don't worry about that.
Imperial Intelligence. It's my job to keep the Empire's superiority secure.
I'm your agent.
Exactly why you're the one for the job.
I will not allow the Imperial military to stumble.
I'm your Sith.
That is evident, my lord.
Fill me in on the details.
What's happened?
The Empire's military superiority is no concern of mine.
Why should I care?
Like it or not, your life is unavoidably intertwined with the Empire.
We don't like what we're seeing. Czerka Corporation has a prototype technology that can detect Imperial starships at twice the distance of typical scanners.
Czerka is shopping this technology to the Republic as we speak.
Then they won't get their hands on this technology.
It'll never reach them.
That's what I like to hear.
What do you need me to do about this tech?
What's the job?
So who do I kill first? The Republic or Czerka?
Tell me who to kill.
Kill whomever you like, but make sure those prototypes and the labs are destroyed.
The prototypes are few, but they're scattered between Czerka's main lab and the corporations Czerka was shopping it to.
All we ask is that you destroy the prototypes, destroy the labs and preferably kill every team leader who's ever heard of the project.
This won't take long.
I guess I could try.
Time to do some damage.
Thank you. With your help, we can teach these corporations what it means to mess with the Empire.
This place--Immortal Enterprises--is a front. It exists solely to give the Empire a view into the Republic's corporations.
I'm sorry. I'm very busy right now.
